intro: Mattiastrum lithospermifolium, commonly known as the stone root leaf plant, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
